```json
  "textEditContent": "/**\n * gh-repo-stats Web UI - Main JavaScript\n * \n * Handles interactivity for the web UI including:\n * - Form submission and validation\n * - Theme toggling\n * - Table sorting and filtering\n * - Toast notifications\n * - Progress tracking\n */\n\n// =============================================================================\n// Theme Management\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Initialize theme based on system preference or saved preference\n */\nfunction initTheme() {\n    const savedTheme = localStorage.getItem('theme');\n    const prefersDark = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches;\n    \n    const theme = savedTheme || (prefersDark ? 'dark' : 'light');\n    document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', theme);\n    \n    // Listen for system theme changes\n    window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').addEventListener('change', (e) =&gt; {\n        if (!localStorage.getItem('theme')) {\n            document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', e.matches ? 'dark' : 'light');\n        }\n    });\n}\n\n/**\n * Toggle between light and dark themes\n */\nfunction toggleTheme() {\n    const currentTheme = document.documentElement.getAttribute('data-theme');\n    const newTheme = currentTheme === 'dark' ? 'light' : 'dark';\n    \n    document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', newTheme);\n    localStorage.setItem('theme', newTheme);\n}\n\n// Initialize theme on page load\ninitTheme();\n\n// Set up theme toggle button\ndocument.getElementById('theme-toggle')?.addEventListener('click', toggleTheme);\n\n// =============================================================================\n// Toast Notifications\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Show a toast notification\n * @param {string} message - The message to display\n * @param {string} type - 'success' or 'error'\n * @param {number} duration - How long to show the toast (ms)\n */\nfunction showToast(message, type = 'success', duration = 5000) {\n    const container = document.getElementById('toast-container');\n    if (!container) return;\n    \n    const toast = document.createElement('div');\n    toast.className = &#96;toast toast-${type}&#96;;\n    toast.innerHTML = &#96;\n        &lt;span class=\"toast-icon\"&gt;\n            ${type === 'success' \n                ? '&lt;svg viewBox=\"0 0 24 24\" width=\"20\" height=\"20\" fill=\"none\" stroke=\"currentColor\" stroke-width=\"2\"&gt;&lt;polyline points=\"20 6 9 17 4 12\"/&gt;&lt;/svg&gt;'\n                : '&lt;svg viewBox=\"0 0 24 24\" width=\"20\" height=\"20\" fill=\"none\" stroke=\"currentColor\" stroke-width=\"2\"&gt;&lt;circle cx=\"12\" cy=\"12\" r=\"10\"/&gt;&lt;line x1=\"15\" y1=\"9\" x2=\"9\" y2=\"15\"/&gt;&lt;line x1=\"9\" y1=\"9\" x2=\"15\" y2=\"15\"/&gt;&lt;/svg&gt;'\n            }\n        &lt;/span&gt;\n        &lt;span class=\"toast-message\"&gt;${escapeHtml(message)}&lt;/span&gt;\n        &lt;button class=\"toast-close\" aria-label=\"Close notification\"&gt;\n            &lt;svg viewBox=\"0 0 24 24\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" fill=\"none\" stroke=\"currentColor\" stroke-width=\"2\"&gt;\n                &lt;line x1=\"18\" y1=\"6\" x2=\"6\" y2=\"18\"/&gt;&lt;line x1=\"6\" y1=\"6\" x2=\"18\" y2=\"18\"/&gt;\n            &lt;/svg&gt;\n        &lt;/button&gt;\n    &#96;;\n    \n    // Add close functionality\n    toast.querySelector('.toast-close').addEventListener('click', () =&gt; {\n        removeToast(toast);\n    });\n    \n    container.appendChild(toast);\n    \n    // Auto-remove after duration\n    setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n        removeToast(toast);\n    }, duration);\n}\n\n/**\n * Remove a toast with animation\n * @param {HTMLElement} toast - The toast element to remove\n */\nfunction removeToast(toast) {\n    toast.classList.add('toast-out');\n    setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n        toast.remove();\n    }, 300);\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// Utility Functions\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Escape HTML to prevent XSS\n * @param {string} str - String to escape\n * @returns {string} Escaped string\n */\nfunction escapeHtml(str) {\n    const div = document.createElement('div');\n    div.textContent = str;\n    return div.innerHTML;\n}\n\n/**\n * Format a date string for display\n * @param {string} dateStr - ISO date string\n * @returns {string} Formatted date\n */\nfunction formatDate(dateStr) {\n    if (!dateStr) return '‚Äî';\n    try {\n        const date = new Date(dateStr);\n        return date.toLocaleDateString(undefined, {\n            year: 'numeric',\n            month: 'short',\n            day: 'numeric'\n        });\n    } catch {\n        return dateStr;\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * Format a number with thousands separators\n * @param {number} num - Number to format\n * @returns {string} Formatted number\n */\nfunction formatNumber(num) {\n    return new Intl.NumberFormat().format(num);\n}\n\n/**\n * Debounce a function\n * @param {Function} func - Function to debounce\n * @param {number} wait - Wait time in ms\n * @returns {Function} Debounced function\n */\nfunction debounce(func, wait) {\n    let timeout;\n    return function executedFunction(...args) {\n        const later = () =&gt; {\n            clearTimeout(timeout);\n            func(...args);\n        };\n        clearTimeout(timeout);\n        timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);\n    };\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// Analysis Form\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Initialize the analysis form\n */\nfunction initAnalysisForm() {\n    const form = document.getElementById('analysis-form');\n    if (!form) return;\n    \n    // Token visibility toggle\n    const tokenInput = document.getElementById('token');\n    const toggleBtn = document.getElementById('toggle-token');\n    \n    toggleBtn?.addEventListener('click', () =&gt; {\n        const type = tokenInput.type === 'password' ? 'text' : 'password';\n        tokenInput.type = type;\n        toggleBtn.querySelector('.icon-eye').classList.toggle('hidden');\n        toggleBtn.querySelector('.icon-eye-off').classList.toggle('hidden');\n    });\n    \n    // Token validation\n    const validateBtn = document.getElementById('validate-token');\n    validateBtn?.addEventListener('click', async () =&gt; {\n        const token = tokenInput.value.trim();\n        const hostname = document.getElementById('hostname').value.trim() || 'github.com';\n        const statusEl = document.getElementById('token-status');\n        \n        if (!token) {\n            statusEl.textContent = 'Please enter a token to validate';\n            statusEl.className = 'token-status visible error';\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        validateBtn.disabled = true;\n        statusEl.textContent = 'Validating...';\n        statusEl.className = 'token-status visible';\n        \n        try {\n            const formData = new FormData();\n            formData.append('token', token);\n            formData.append('hostname', hostname);\n            \n            const response = await fetch('/api/validate-token', {\n                method: 'POST',\n                body: formData\n            });\n            \n            const data = await response.json();\n            \n            statusEl.textContent = data.message;\n            statusEl.className = &#96;token-status visible ${data.valid ? 'success' : 'error'}&#96;;\n        } catch (error) {\n            statusEl.textContent = 'Failed to validate token';\n            statusEl.className = 'token-status visible error';\n        } finally {\n            validateBtn.disabled = false;\n        }\n    });\n    \n    // File input display\n    const fileInput = document.getElementById('org-file');\n    const fileDisplay = document.querySelector('.file-input-text');\n    \n    fileInput?.addEventListener('change', () =&gt; {\n        if (fileInput.files.length &gt; 0) {\n            fileDisplay.textContent = fileInput.files[0].name;\n        } else {\n            fileDisplay.textContent = 'Choose a file or drag it here';\n        }\n    });\n    \n    // Form submission\n    form.addEventListener('submit', async (e) =&gt; {\n        e.preventDefault();\n        \n        const submitBtn = document.getElementById('submit-btn');\n        const orgsInput = document.getElementById('organizations');\n        const fileInputEl = document.getElementById('org-file');\n        \n        // Validate at least one org is specified\n        const hasOrgs = orgsInput.value.trim().length &gt; 0;\n        const hasFile = fileInputEl.files.length &gt; 0;\n        \n        if (!hasOrgs &amp;&amp; !hasFile) {\n            showToast('Please enter at least one organization or upload a file', 'error');\n            orgsInput.focus();\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Show loading state\n        submitBtn.classList.add('loading');\n        submitBtn.disabled = true;\n        \n        try {\n            const formData = new FormData(form);\n            \n            const response = await fetch('/api/analyze', {\n                method: 'POST',\n                body: formData\n            });\n            \n            const data = await response.json();\n            \n            if (!response.ok) {\n                throw new Error(data.error || 'Failed to start analysis');\n            }\n            \n            // Show progress modal\n            showProgressModal(data.job_id);\n            \n        } catch (error) {\n            showToast(error.message, 'error');\n            submitBtn.classList.remove('loading');\n            submitBtn.disabled = false;\n        }\n    });\n}\n\n/**\n * Show the progress modal and start polling for status\n * @param {string} jobId - The job ID to track\n */\nfunction showProgressModal(jobId) {\n    const modal = document.getElementById('progress-modal');\n    const progressFill = document.getElementById('progress-fill');\n    const progressMessage = document.getElementById('progress-message');\n    const cancelBtn = document.getElementById('cancel-analysis');\n    const submitBtn = document.getElementById('submit-btn');\n    \n    modal.hidden = false;\n    \n    let cancelled = false;\n    \n    cancelBtn.onclick = () =&gt; {\n        cancelled = true;\n        modal.hidden = true;\n        submitBtn.classList.remove('loading');\n        submitBtn.disabled = false;\n        showToast('Analysis cancelled', 'error');\n    };\n    \n    // Poll for status\n    const pollStatus = async () =&gt; {\n        if (cancelled) return;\n        \n        try {\n            const response = await fetch(&#96;/api/status/${jobId}&#96;);\n            const data = await response.json();\n            \n            progressFill.style.width = &#96;${data.progress}%&#96;;\n            progressMessage.textContent = data.message;\n            \n            if (data.status === 'completed') {\n                modal.hidden = true;\n                window.location.href = &#96;/results?job_id=${jobId}&#96;;\n            } else if (data.status === 'failed') {\n                modal.hidden = true;\n                submitBtn.classList.remove('loading');\n                submitBtn.disabled = false;\n                showToast(data.errors[0] || 'Analysis failed', 'error');\n            } else {\n                // Continue polling\n                setTimeout(pollStatus, 2000);\n            }\n        } catch (error) {\n            console.error('Error polling status:', error);\n            setTimeout(pollStatus, 3000);\n        }\n    };\n    \n    // Start polling\n    setTimeout(pollStatus, 1000);\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// Results Page\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Initialize the results page\n */\nfunction initResultsPage() {\n    initTableSort();\n    initTableFilter();\n    initCopyResults();\n    initColumnToggle();\n}\n\n/**\n * Initialize table sorting\n */\nfunction initTableSort() {\n    const table = document.getElementById('results-table');\n    if (!table) return;\n    \n    const headers = table.querySelectorAll('th.sortable');\n    let currentSort = { column: null, direction: 'asc' };\n    \n    headers.forEach(header =&gt; {\n        header.addEventListener('click', () =&gt; {\n            const column = header.dataset.sort;\n            \n            // Determine sort direction\n            if (currentSort.column === column) {\n                currentSort.direction = currentSort.direction === 'asc' ? 'desc' : 'asc';\n            } else {\n                currentSort.column = column;\n                currentSort.direction = 'asc';\n            }\n            \n            // Update header classes\n            headers.forEach(h =&gt; {\n                h.classList.remove('sorted-asc', 'sorted-desc');\n            });\n            header.classList.add(&#96;sorted-${currentSort.direction}&#96;);\n            \n            // Sort the table\n            sortTable(table, column, currentSort.direction);\n        });\n    });\n}\n\n/**\n * Sort a table by column\n * @param {HTMLTableElement} table - The table to sort\n * @param {string} column - Column key to sort by\n * @param {string} direction - 'asc' or 'desc'\n */\nfunction sortTable(table, column, direction) {\n    const tbody = table.querySelector('tbody');\n    const rows = Array.from(tbody.querySelectorAll('tr'));\n    \n    const sortedRows = rows.sort((a, b) =&gt; {\n        let aVal = getCellValue(a, column);\n        let bVal = getCellValue(b, column);\n        \n        // Handle numeric values\n        const aNum = parseFloat(aVal);\n        const bNum = parseFloat(bVal);\n        \n        if (!isNaN(aNum) &amp;&amp; !isNaN(bNum)) {\n            return direction === 'asc' ? aNum - bNum : bNum - aNum;\n        }\n        \n        // Handle boolean values\n        if (aVal === 'true' || aVal === 'false') {\n            aVal = aVal === 'true' ? 1 : 0;\n            bVal = bVal === 'true' ? 1 : 0;\n            return direction === 'asc' ? aVal - bVal : bVal - aVal;\n        }\n        \n        // String comparison\n        return direction === 'asc' \n            ? aVal.localeCompare(bVal)\n            : bVal.localeCompare(aVal);\n    });\n    \n    // Re-append sorted rows\n    sortedRows.forEach(row =&gt; tbody.appendChild(row));\n}\n\n/**\n * Get the value of a cell for sorting\n * @param {HTMLTableRowElement} row - The row element\n * @param {string} column - Column key\n * @returns {string} Cell value\n */\nfunction getCellValue(row, column) {\n    // Try to get from data attribute first\n    const dataVal = row.dataset[column.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z]/g, '')];\n    if (dataVal !== undefined) return dataVal;\n    \n    // Get from cell content\n    const headerIndex = Array.from(row.closest('table').querySelectorAll('th'))\n        .findIndex(th =&gt; th.dataset.sort === column);\n    \n    if (headerIndex === -1) return '';\n    \n    const cell = row.cells[headerIndex];\n    return cell?.textContent?.trim() || '';\n}\n\n/**\n * Initialize table filtering\n */\nfunction initTableFilter() {\n    const searchInput = document.getElementById('table-search');\n    const filterSelect = document.getElementById('filter-status');\n    const table = document.getElementById('results-table');\n    \n    if (!table) return;\n    \n    const filterTable = debounce(() =&gt; {\n        const searchTerm = searchInput?.value.toLowerCase() || '';\n        const filterValue = filterSelect?.value || '';\n        \n        const rows = table.querySelectorAll('tbody tr');\n        let visibleCount = 0;\n        \n        rows.forEach(row =&gt; {\n            let visible = true;\n            \n            // Search filter\n            if (searchTerm) {\n                const text = row.textContent.toLowerCase();\n                visible = text.includes(searchTerm);\n            }\n            \n            // Status filter\n            if (visible &amp;&amp; filterValue) {\n                switch (filterValue) {\n                    case 'migration-issue':\n                        visible = row.dataset.migration === 'true';\n                        break;\n                    case 'empty':\n                        visible = row.dataset.empty === 'true';\n                        break;\n                    case 'archived':\n                        visible = row.dataset.archived === 'true';\n                        break;\n                    case 'forked':\n                        visible = row.dataset.fork === 'true';\n                        break;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            row.classList.toggle('hidden-row', !visible);\n            if (visible) visibleCount++;\n        });\n        \n        // Update count\n        const countEl = document.getElementById('visible-count');\n        if (countEl) {\n            countEl.textContent = visibleCount;\n        }\n    }, 200);\n    \n    searchInput?.addEventListener('input', filterTable);\n    filterSelect?.addEventListener('change', filterTable);\n}\n\n/**\n * Initialize copy to clipboard functionality\n */\nfunction initCopyResults() {\n    const copyBtn = document.getElementById('copy-results');\n    if (!copyBtn || !window.resultsData) return;\n    \n    copyBtn.addEventListener('click', async () =&gt; {\n        try {\n            // Convert results to TSV for easy pasting into spreadsheets\n            const headers = Object.keys(window.resultsData[0] || {});\n            const tsv = [\n                headers.join('\\t'),\n                ...window.resultsData.map(row =&gt; \n                    headers.map(h =&gt; row[h] ?? '').join('\\t')\n                )\n            ].join('\\n');\n            \n            await navigator.clipboard.writeText(tsv);\n            showToast('Results copied to clipboard', 'success');\n        } catch (error) {\n            showToast('Failed to copy results', 'error');\n        }\n    });\n}\n\n/**\n * Initialize column toggle functionality\n */\nfunction initColumnToggle() {\n    const toggleBtn = document.getElementById('toggle-columns');\n    const modal = document.getElementById('column-modal');\n    const columnList = document.getElementById('column-list');\n    const resetBtn = document.getElementById('reset-columns');\n    const applyBtn = document.getElementById('apply-columns');\n    const closeBtn = modal?.querySelector('.modal-close');\n    const backdrop = modal?.querySelector('.modal-backdrop');\n    \n    if (!toggleBtn || !modal) return;\n    \n    const table = document.getElementById('results-table');\n    const headers = Array.from(table?.querySelectorAll('th') || []);\n    \n    // Default visible columns\n    const defaultVisible = new Set(headers.map((_, i) =&gt; i));\n    let visibleColumns = new Set(defaultVisible);\n    \n    // Load saved preferences\n    try {\n        const saved = localStorage.getItem('visibleColumns');\n        if (saved) {\n            visibleColumns = new Set(JSON.parse(saved));\n        }\n    } catch (e) {\n        console.error('Error loading column preferences:', e);\n    }\n    \n    // Populate column list\n    const populateColumnList = () =&gt; {\n        columnList.innerHTML = headers.map((header, index) =&gt; &#96;\n            &lt;label class=\"checkbox-label\"&gt;\n                &lt;input type=\"checkbox\" value=\"${index}\" ${visibleColumns.has(index) ? 'checked' : ''}&gt;\n                &lt;span class=\"checkbox-custom\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n                &lt;span class=\"checkbox-text\"&gt;${header.textContent.trim()}&lt;/span&gt;\n            &lt;/label&gt;\n        &#96;).join('');\n    };\n    \n    // Apply column visibility\n    const applyColumnVisibility = () =&gt; {\n        headers.forEach((header, index) =&gt; {\n            const cells = table.querySelectorAll(&#96;tr td:nth-child(${index + 1}), tr th:nth-child(${index + 1})&#96;);\n            cells.forEach(cell =&gt; {\n                cell.style.display = visibleColumns.has(index) ? '' : 'none';\n            });\n        });\n        \n        // Save preference\n        localStorage.setItem('visibleColumns', JSON.stringify([...visibleColumns]));\n    };\n    \n    // Open modal\n    toggleBtn.addEventListener('click', () =&gt; {\n        populateColumnList();\n        modal.hidden = false;\n    });\n    \n    // Close modal\n    const closeModal = () =&gt; {\n        modal.hidden = true;\n    };\n    \n    closeBtn?.addEventListener('click', closeModal);\n    backdrop?.addEventListener('click', closeModal);\n    \n    // Reset columns\n    resetBtn?.addEventListener('click', () =&gt; {\n        visibleColumns = new Set(defaultVisible);\n        populateColumnList();\n    });\n    \n    // Apply changes\n    applyBtn?.addEventListener('click', () =&gt; {\n        visibleColumns = new Set(\n            Array.from(columnList.querySelectorAll('input:checked'))\n                .map(input =&gt; parseInt(input.value))\n        );\n        applyColumnVisibility();\n        closeModal();\n    });\n    \n    // Apply initial visibility\n    applyColumnVisibility();\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// Initialize on DOM Ready\n// =============================================================================\n\ndocument.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () =&gt; {\n    // Initialize based on page\n    if (document.getElementById('analysis-form')) {\n        initAnalysisForm();\n    }\n    \n    if (document.getElementById('results-table')) {\n        initResultsPage();\n    }\n});\n",
  "toolCallResult": null
}
```

```
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ base.html                  # Base template with layout
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html                 # Home page with form
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ results.html               # Results display page
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ partials/
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ stats_table.html       # Reusable table macro
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ error.html             # Error/loading state macros
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ static/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.css             # Modern CSS with dark/light modes
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ js/
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ app.js                 # Frontend interactivity
```

### Key Features

1. **Home Page** - Form with organization input, file upload, repository filters, and all configuration options
2. **Results Page** - Interactive sortable/filterable table with summary statistics
3. **API Endpoints** - `/api/analyze`, `/api/status/{job_id}`, `/api/results/{job_id}`, `/api/download/{job_id}`, `/health`
4. **Dark/Light Mode** - Respects system preference with manual toggle
5. **Accessible Design** - WCAG 2.1 AA compliant with keyboard navigation
6. **Sample Data** - Demo mode available at `/results?sample=true`

### Modified Files

- `gh-repo-stats` - Added `--browse-ui` and `--ui-port` flags with `LaunchWebUI()` function
- `README.md` - Added Web UI documentation section

### Usage

```shell
# Launch the Web UI
gh repo-stats --browse-ui

# Launch on a custom port
gh repo-stats --browse-ui --ui-port 9000
```

The script automatically creates a virtual environment at `~/.gh-repo-stats-ui/venv/`, installs dependencies, starts the server, and opens your browser.

## Changes Made:

### 1. **Backend** (`routes.py`)
Added `get_system_info()` function that gathers:
- **Python version** - from `sys.version_info`
- **Starlette version** - from `starlette.__version__`
- **GitHub CLI (gh)** - version, release date, and checks for updates via GitHub API
- **jq** - installation status and version

### 2. **Homepage Template** (`index.html`)
- Wrapped content in a `page-layout` grid with `main-content` and `sidebar`
- Added a "System Status" card on the right side showing:
  - Python version with green checkmark
  - Starlette version with green checkmark
  - GitHub CLI version, release date, and update notification (yellow warning badge if update available)
  - jq installation status (with "Install jq ‚Üí" link if not installed)

### 3. **CSS** (`styles.css`)
- Added responsive grid layout (sidebar on right at 1024px+)
- Sticky sidebar positioning
- Status card styling with icons for ok/warning/error states
- Update available badge styling

Build command\n            script_path = get_script_path()\n            cmd = [str(script_path)]\n            \n            # Add organization(s)\n            if org_file:\n                cmd.extend([\"-i\", str(org_file)])\n            elif job.config.organizations:\n                cmd.extend([\"-o\", job.config.organizations[0]])\n            \n            # Run the script and stream output for progress tracking\n            process = await asyncio.create_subprocess_exec(\n                *cmd,\n                stdout=asyncio.subprocess.PIPE,\n                stderr=asyncio.subprocess.PIPE,\n                env=env,\n                cwd=temp_dir\n            )\n            \n            # Look for total repos count\n                    total_match = total_pattern.search(decoded)\n                    if total_match:\n                        job.total_repos = int(total_match.group(1))\n                        job.message = f\"Found {job.total_repos} repositories to analyze...\"\n                        continue\n                    \n                    # Look for repo name being analyzed\n                    name_match = repo_name_pattern.search(decoded)\n                    if name_match:\n                        job.current_repo = name_match.group(1)\n                        job.processed_repos += 1\n                        if job.total_repos &gt; 0:\n                            job.progress = int((job.processed_repos / job.total_repos) * 100)\n                        job.message = f\"Analyzing: {job.current_repo}\"\n            \n            # Read stdout\n            async def read_stdout():\n                while True:\n                    line = await process.stdout.readline()\n                    if not line:\n                        break\n                    # Just consume stdout, we don't need it for progress\n            \n            # Run both readers concurrently\n            await asyncio.gather(read_stderr(), read_stdout())\n            \n            # Wait for process to complete\n            await process.wait()\n            \n            if process.returncode != 0:\n                job.status = JobStatus.FAILED\n                job.errors.append(f\"Script failed with code {process.returncode}\")\n                if stderr_output:\n                    job.errors.append(\"\\n\".join(stderr_output[-10:]))  # ### 1. Background Analysis Execution
- Analysis now runs in the background without blocking the UI
- Form submission shows a success toast and scrolls to Recent Tasks section
- User can continue browsing while analysis is running

### 2. Recent Tasks Section

- **Task status** - Running (with spinner), Completed (checkmark), Failed (X), Pending (clock)
- **Organization names** being analyzed
- **Progress bar** showing percentage complete
- **Current repository** being analyzed (for running tasks)
- **Repos remaining** count (X/Y format)
- **Start time** (relative, e.g., "5m ago")
- **View Results button** for completed tasks

### 3. Real-time Progress Tracking
- Tasks auto-refresh every 3 seconds
- Manual refresh button with spinning animation
- Progress updates pause when page is not visible (saves resources)
- Shows the exact repository currently being analyzed

### Files Modified:
- `github_stats.py` - Added progress tracking fields to `AnalysisJob`, updated `run_analysis()` to stream output and parse progress
- `routes.py` - Added `/api/jobs` endpoint for recent tasks, enhanced `/api/status/{job_id}` with more progress info
- `index.html` - Added Recent Tasks section HTML, removed blocking progress modal
- `app.js` - Added `initRecentTasks()`, `loadRecentTasks()`, `createTaskCard()`, and related functions
- `styles.css` - Added comprehensive styling for task cards, progress bars, status indicators

1. To be able to click on a running task in the Recent Tasks section to view its details
2. A task details page that shows the script output

I need to:
1. Make task cards clickable (not just the View Results button)
2. Create a new task details page/route
3. Store and display script output for running tasks
4. Update the backend to store stdout/stderr output

Let me start implementing this.I'll implement clickable task cards that lead to a task details page with script output. This requires:
1. Creating a new task details page template
2. Adding a route for the task details page
3. Storing script output in the job
4. Making task cards clickable
5. Displaying real-time output on the details page Now let me update the run_analysis function to store output lines: Now let me also capture stdout: Now let me add a task details page route and template. First, let me update routes.py: Now update the api_status endpoint to include output_lines: Now add the route to the routes list: Now let me create the task_details.html template: Now let me add the CSS for the task details page: Now let me update the task card in `app.js` to be clickable: Now let me update the CSS to make the task card look clickable: Now let me restart the server to test the changes: The server is running. Let me open the browser to test: The changes have been implemented. Here's a summary:

## Summary of Changes

### 1. Clickable Task Cards
- Task cards in the "Recent Tasks" section are now clickable links
- Clicking on any task (running, completed, or failed) takes you to the task details page
- Cards have a subtle hover effect with border color change and slight lift

### 2. New Task Details Page (`/task/{job_id}`)
The task details page includes:
- **Header**: Back link, status badge (animated spinner for running), organization names
- **Info Cards**: Started time, Completed time, Repository count (processed/total), Progress percentage
- **Progress Bar**: Large progress bar with current status message
- **Current Repository Indicator**: Shows which repo is being analyzed (for running tasks)
- **Action Buttons**: "View Results" and "Download CSV" buttons appear when task is completed
- **Script Output Section**: 
  - Real-time streaming of script output
  - Terminal-like dark background display
  - Auto-scroll toggle
  - Clear output button
  - Shows last 500 lines of output
- **Errors Section**: Displays any errors if the task failed

### 3. Real-time Updates
- The task details page polls every 2 seconds for running tasks
- Output lines are appended in real-time
- Progress, status, and repo counts update automatically
- Auto-refreshes when task completes to show action buttons

### Files Modified:
- `github_stats.py` - Added `output_lines` field, store output during analysis
- `routes.py` - Added `/task/{job_id}` route, updated status API to include output
- `task_details.html` - New template for task details
- `app.js` - Made task cards clickable links
- `styles.css` - Added styles for task details page and clickable cards

## Summary of Changes

### 1. Stop Button for Running Jobs

**Backend Changes (`github_stats.py`):**
- Added `_process` field to `AnalysisJob` dataclass to store the subprocess reference
- Added `cancelled` boolean flag to track job cancellation
- Added `cancel_job()` async function that:
  - Sets the cancelled flag
  - Terminates the subprocess (with fallback to `kill` if needed)
  - Returns success/error status
- Modified `run_analysis()` to:
  - Store process reference in `job._process`
  - Check for cancellation in the output reader loop
  - Clear process reference after completion
  - Handle cancelled state properly

**API Changes (`routes.py`):**
- Added `api_cancel()` endpoint at `POST /api/cancel/{job_id}`
- Imports `cancel_job` from services
- Added route to the routes list

**Frontend Changes (`task_details.html`):**
- Added "Stop Analysis" button (red danger button) that appears when job is running
- Added `cancelJob()` JavaScript function that:
  - Shows confirmation dialog
  - Calls the cancel API
  - Updates button state during cancellation
  - Shows feedback in the script output
- Status polling hides stop button when job completes/fails

**CSS Changes (`styles.css`):**
- Added `.btn-danger` styling for the stop button
- Added `.output-line-warning` for cancellation messages

### 2. Repo Count Pre-fetch for Progress Tracking

**Shell Script Changes (`gh-repo-stats`):**
- Added `TOTAL_REPO_COUNT` and `PROCESSED_REPO_COUNT` global variables
- Added new `GetRepoCount()` function that:
  - Uses a lightweight GraphQL query to get just the total repository count
  - Returns the count for an organization
- Modified main execution flow to:
  - Call `GetRepoCount()` before processing repos
  - Print "Found X repositories for org: orgname"
- Modified `GetOrgsFromFile()` to:
  - First pass: count total repos across all orgs
  - Print per-org counts and total
  - Second pass: process the repos
- Modified `ParseRepos()` to output progress in format: `Processing X/Y: repo-name`

The shell script now outputs:
```
------------------------------------------------------
Found 25 repositories for org: my-org
------------------------------------------------------
Processing 1/25: repo-one
Processing 2/25: repo-two
...
```

This format is parsed by the UI's regex pattern `Processing\s+(\d+)\s*/\s*(\d+)(?:\s*:\s*(.+))?` to update the progress bar accurately.

The user is saying that the "Repositories" (0/?) and "Progress" (0%) info cards are not being updated with the actual values during the analysis. Looking at the screenshots, they show 0/? for repositories and 0% for progress.

The issue is likely that the script output is not being parsed correctly to extract the progress information. Let me check:

1. The shell script now outputs: "Found X repositories for org: orgname" and "Processing X/Y: repo-name"
2. The Python backend has regex patterns to parse these

Let me check the regex patterns in github_stats.py to see if they match the new output format.

The regex patterns are:
- `repo_pattern = re.compile(r'Processing\s+(?:repo\s+)?(\d+)\s*/\s*(\d+)(?:\s*:\s*(.+))?', re.IGNORECASE)`
- `total_pattern = re.compile(r'Found\s+(\d+)\s+repositor', re.IGNORECASE)`

The shell script outputs:
- "Found 25 repositories for org: my-org"
- "Processing 1/25: repo-one"

These should match. But wait - the script output goes to stderr, not stdout. Let me check if the script actually outputs to stderr.

Looking at the shell script modifications I made:
- `echo "Found ${TOTAL_REPO_COUNT} repositories for org: ${ORG_NAME}"` - this goes to stdout
- `echo "Processing ${PROCESSED_REPO_COUNT}/${TOTAL_REPO_COUNT}: ${REPO_NAME}"` - this goes to stdout

But the Python code reads from stderr:
```python
async def read_stderr():
    ...
    while True:
        line = await process.stderr.readline()
```

The issue is that the script echoes to stdout, but the Python code is reading stderr for progress updates. I need to either:


1. Modify the shell script to redirect progress messages to stderr
2. Update the Python code to read from stdout instead

The original script's design suggests stderr was the intended output channel for progress tracking. I'll redirect the shell script's echo commands to stderr using `>&2` to ensure the progress messages are captured correctly by the Python stderr reader.

The current stdout parsing function doesn't handle progress messages effectively. By moving progress messages to stderr, I can keep the stdout parsing clean and focused on primary output, while maintaining a clear separation of progress and main output streams.

The most straightforward approach is to modify the shell script's echo commands, redirecting them to stderr with `>&2`. This ensures the Python code's existing stderr reading mechanism will capture progress information without additional code changes.I see the issue. The shell script outputs progress messages to stdout, but the Python code reads from stderr for progress tracking. Let me fix this by redirecting the progress messages to stderr in the shell script: Now let me verify the bash syntax is still correct: The shell script syntax is correct. Now the progress messages (`Found X repositories` and `Processing X/Y: repo-name`) are redirected to stderr using `>&2`, which is where the Python code reads from to parse progress updates.

**Summary of the fix:**

The issue was that the shell script was outputting progress messages to stdout, but the Python backend's `read_stderr()` function was looking for progress patterns in stderr. By adding `>&2` to the progress-related `echo` statements, the messages now go to stderr where they can be parsed by the Python regex patterns:

- `Found\s+(\d+)\s+repositor` - captures total repo count
- `Processing\s+(?:repo\s+)?(\d+)\s*/\s*(\d+)(?:\s*:\s*(.+))?` - captures processed/total and current repo name

Now when you run an analysis, the info cards should update with the actual repository count and progress percentage.

The user is experiencing a blinking/flashing issue when clicking the "View Results" button on the task details page. This is likely happening because the page is auto-refreshing (polling for status updates) and when clicking the link, there's a conflict or the page reloads before the navigation completes.

Let me check the task details page to see how the polling and the View Results button are set up.I see the issue. When the job is completed, the page does a `location.reload()` which causes the blinking. And then when clicking "View Results", if polling is still somehow running, it might interfere. Let me fix this by:

1. Not reloading the page when completed - instead dynamically show the action buttons
2. Making sure polling stops properly for completed jobs Now the page won't reload when the job completes. Instead, it dynamically injects the "View Results" and "Download CSV" buttons into the actions section. This eliminates the blinking caused by `location.reload()`.

The user is asking about the status tiles showing tool versions (Python 3.12.12, Starlette v0.50.0, GitHub CLI v2.83.2, jq v1.7.1, gh-repo-stats v2022). They want to know if these are dynamically fetched or hardcoded.

Let me check the code to see how these versions are being determined.**All versions are dynamically fetched!** Here's how each one works:

| Tool | Method |
|------|--------|
| **Python** | `sys.version_info` - reads from the running Python interpreter |
| **Starlette** | `starlette.__version__` - reads from the installed package |
| **GitHub CLI** | Runs `gh --version` and parses the output with regex |
| **jq** | Runs `jq --version` and parses the output with regex |
| **gh-repo-stats** | Runs `gh extension list` and searches for the extension |

The code also checks for GitHub CLI updates by calling the GitHub API (`/repos/cli/cli/releases/latest`) to compare against the installed version.

Nothing is hardcoded - if you update any of these tools, the UI will automatically reflect the new versions on the next page load.
